creator: rstinehour@crosslogic.com
text:
I think the classpath is correct.

When running JMeter bat file:

getopts: not found
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NOClassDefFoundError: Files\PhotoDeluxe

creator: rstinehour@crosslogic.com
text:
From the command prompt, when running jmeter I get:
  getopts: not found
  Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError : Files\PhotoDeluxe

From within IBM WebShpere Studio Application Developer I get:
1. a Log4j error upon startup of NewDriver
log4j:ERROR No appenders could be found for category jmeter.util.ClassFinder).
log4j:ERROR Please initialize the log4j system properly.

2. File Reporter does not write to the results file due to a null pointer 
   exception while getting the properties.

I suspect I have classpath problems.  I ran the build.xml, and put 
activation.jar in the lib directory.  I am running jsdk 1.5, windows 2k.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
Hard to guess what's going on.  I don't know what Files/PhotoDeluxe refers to -
certainly nothing in JMeter.  Your system classpath should be cleared to run
JMeter (in general, setting your system classpath is a bad idea).  Perhaps you
could try a newer version of JMeter?

Files\PhotoDeluxe probably comes from having CLASSPATH-variable which contains 
space character ( "Program Files" -> "Files"). In some environments & 
configurations spaces in classpath is handled incorrecly.

A fix is to reset CLASSPATH just before starting JMeter. E.g. set CLASSPATH=
creator: jarkko.lietolahti@sysopen.fi
jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-editing to close all bugs reported fixed by 1.8.1.
